item.title: Magnetic resonance - Rabi's oscillation
item.description: The system of Rabi oscillation Neutral atom with spin 1/2 is immersed in the magnetic field of $\vec{B} = B_0 \hat{z}+B_1\left( cos(wt)\hat{x}+sin(wt)\hat{y}\right)$ where the magnetic field is rotating anti-clockwise with respect to z axis with angular frequency $w$. The the magnetic moment of the atom is, $$\begin{equation} \hat{\mu} = \frac{e}{m}\hat{S} = \frac{e}{m}\frac{\hbar}{2}\hat{\sigma} \end{equation}$$ The Hamiltonian of the system is then, $$\begin{equation} \hat{H} = -\hat{\mu}\cdot\hat{B} = \frac{\hbar}{2} \begin{pmatrix} \Omega_0 & \Omega_1 e^{-iwt} \\ \Omega_1 e^{iwt} & -\Omega_0\end{pmatrix} \end{equation}$$

item.title: About
item.description: Hi, how are you? I hope this homepage will share my thoughts on physics and perhaps enlighten you. Also, I want to record my journey into the realms of physics. This homepage may work as my portfolio. I’m interested in simulating physical phenomenons. Not everyone can simulate or let alone draw physical equations in their mind. To help people persue for their physics degree, I’m planning to share simulation of textbook level problems.
